title: Implement Core lint (type-check Core IR for internal consistency)
body:
Implement a Core lint pass that type-checks the Core IR to catch internal compiler bugs.

**Deliverables:**
- `lintCoreProgram(program) -> [Diagnostic]` that checks:
  - All variables are in scope
  - All applications are well-typed
  - Case alternatives are exhaustive and consistent
  - Let bindings have consistent types
  - No unbound variables
- Run lint after desugaring and after any Core transformation
- Lint errors are internal compiler errors (ICE), not user-facing
- Unit tests with deliberately malformed Core

**Design notes:**
- GHC's Core Lint (`compiler/GHC/Core/Lint.hs`) is the gold standard
- Core is the 'type-safety firewall' — if Core type-checks, later stages can be trusted
- This is a debugging aid; can be gated behind a flag for performance
